title: Daily Market Digest
subtitle: February 28, 2026: Market Pulse on AI Fears and Inflation

items.headline: U.S. Stocks Sink Amid AI Revolution Fears and Inflation Concerns
items.summary: U.S. stocks experienced a broad sell-off on Friday, February 27, 2026, as Wall Street continued to penalize companies perceived as potential losers in the artificial intelligence revolution. A surprisingly discouraging update on inflation further dampened market sentiment, while rising oil prices, fueled by tensions between the United States and Iran, also contributed to the downturn. All major indices closed lower, with the S&P 500 ending its second losing month in the last ten.

items.headline: Block Soars on AI-Driven Job Cuts
items.summary: Shares of Block ($SQ), the company behind Cash App and Square, surged after announcing it would cut nearly half its workforce, attributing the move to AI tools replacing human roles.

items.headline: Netflix Jumps After Exiting Warner Bros. Discovery Bid
items.summary: Netflix ($NFLX) stock climbed as investors reacted positively to the company's decision to abandon its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery.

items.headline: Dell Surges on Strong AI Server Demand and Buyback Plan
items.summary: Dell Technologies ($DELL) saw a significant increase in its stock price, driven by expectations of doubling revenue from its AI-optimized servers business in fiscal year 2027 and a substantial share buyback plan.

items.headline: Nvidia Extends Slide Amid AI Capex Skepticism
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) continued its decline, as skepticism grew among investors regarding the sustainability of AI capital expenditures by major tech firms.

items.headline: Zscaler Plunges on Wider Net Loss Report
items.summary: Cloud security firm Zscaler ($ZS) experienced a sharp drop in its stock after reporting a wider net loss in its second quarter.

items.headline: CoreWeave Sinks on Disappointing Guidance
items.summary: CoreWeave's stock fell significantly following disappointing guidance, contributing to broader market concerns.

items.headline: Hotter-Than-Expected January Inflation Data Rattles Markets
items.summary: January's Producer Price Index (PPI) data showed a significant rise, with the headline PPI increasing 0.5% month-over-month (above the expected 0.3%) and Core PPI surging 0.8% (more than double forecasts). Year-over-year, headline PPI climbed 2.9% and core inflation hit 3.6%. Services inflation also jumped 0.8%, marking its biggest monthly rise since July 2025. These figures suggested companies are passing tariff costs to consumers and complicated the outlook for Federal Reserve rate cuts.

items.headline: Healthcare and Energy Lead as Defensive Sectors Outperform
items.summary: On Friday, healthcare and energy sectors, bolstered by rising crude prices, emerged as leading gainers within the S&P 500. Defensive sectors such as consumer staples and utilities also outperformed. Conversely, financial and technology stocks suffered losses, with tech shares, chips, and software weighing heavily on the indices.

items.headline: Fed Minutes Reveal Divided Views on Future Rate Cuts
items.summary: Minutes from the Federal Reserve's January 27-28, 2026 meeting, released on February 18, 2026, indicated divided opinions among officials regarding the necessity and timing of future interest rate cuts. While several officials suggested additional cuts might be appropriate if inflation continues to decline, others favored keeping rates unchanged for some time. The Fed had previously held its key interest rate steady at a range of 3.5%-3.75% at that meeting.

items.headline: SQM Reports Strong 2025 Earnings Reversal
items.summary: Sociedad Qu√≠mica y Minera de Chile S.A. ($SQM) reported a net income of US$588.1 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2025, a significant turnaround from a net loss in the prior year. The company's fourth-quarter 2025 revenues increased by 23.3% year-over-year.

items.headline: TKO Group Holdings Posts Q4 and Full-Year 2025 Results, Announces Share Repurchase Plan
items.summary: TKO Group Holdings, Inc. ($TKO) announced Q4 2025 revenue of $1.038 billion and a net income of $0.8 million, with full-year 2025 revenue reaching $4.735 billion and net income of $546.2 million. The company also stated its intention to launch up to $1 billion in share repurchases in March 2026.
